docs.title: Corelytics Cloud Explorer
docs.text:
Welcome to the official documentation for Cloud Explorer — the compliance-aware, multi-cloud navigation and intelligence platform.

This site includes architecture notes, UI documentation, compliance mappings, the data pipeline, and the overall roadmap.

docs.title: Recently Released
docs.text:
• CMMC Level 1 + Level 2 support
  • Framework switching engine
  • Provider pipeline rebuild
  • JSONZ compressed provider trees

docs.title: NIST 800-53
docs.text: Details for NIST mappings within Cloud Explorer.

docs.title: CLI Ingestors
docs.text:
Each provider uses:

  • recursive help tree crawling
  • ANSI removal
  • resumable caching
  • option parsing
  • JSON tree output

docs.title: Compliance Frameworks
docs.text:
Supported:

  • NIST 800-53
  • FedRAMP
  • CMMC Level 1 & 2

Frameworks are normalized into a shared structure.

docs.title: Data Pipeline Overview
docs.text:
Cloud Explorer’s ingestion & mapping pipeline includes:

  1. Provider CLI crawlers
  2. Framework loaders
  3. AI-based mapping generator
  4. Runtime merge model

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Fork, branch, and submit PRs. Include before/after examples.

docs.title: Control Mode
docs.text:
Allows: - Framework switching - Browsing controls - Seeing mapped commands

AI narratives included when available.

docs.title: UI Overview
docs.text:
Cloud Explorer UI operates in two modes: - Provider Mode - Control Mode

Optimized for large datasets and instant navigation.

docs.title: Provider Mode
docs.text: Displays: - Provider icons - CLI command trees - Help text & options - Evidence snippets
